qas.question: What are three pests pesticides target?
Are pesticides chemical or biological agents?

answers.text: a pesticide is a chemical or biological agent

qas.question: What are possible cons of pesticides?

answers.text: potential toxicity to humans and other species

qas.question: What are pesticides meant to prevent?

answers.text: destroy property, cause nuisance, or spread disease, or are disease vectors

qas.question: How many microbes exist that are dangerous to humans?
What do nematodes do when they infect a host?
What is the danger of people eating some mollusks?
How many types of poisonous mollusks are there in the wild?
What does being immunized against a virus help prevent?

context: In general, <a1_0>a pesticide is a chemical or biological agent<a1_0/> (such as a virus, bacterium, antimicrobial, or disinfectant) that deters, <b5_0>incapacitates, kills<b5_0/>, or otherwise discourages pests. Target pests can include insects, <a0_0>plant pathogens, weeds, mollusks<a0_0/>, birds, mammals, fish, nematodes (roundworms), and microbes that <a3_0>destroy property, cause nuisance, or spread <b8_0>disease<b8_0/>, or are disease vectors<a3_0/>. Although pesticides have benefits, some also have drawbacks, such as <a2_0><b6_0>potential toxicity<b6_0/> to humans and other species<a2_0/>. According to the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants, <b7_0>9<b7_0/> of the <b4_0>12<b4_0/> most dangerous and persistent organic chemicals are organochlorine pesticides.
